Key Match Events: England won by 8 wickets (with 101 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: England aim to revive rocky title defence against Oman
England need to win their remaining games, and for Australia to beat Scotland to have a chance of making the next round
Oman are currently number one as far as drops go - a total of eight putting them bottom on the catching front in the T20 World Cup
Aqib Ilyas' party trick of bowling offspin to left-handers and leg breaks to right-handers has been effective enough
England are set to continue with dual pace-threat of Mark Wood and Jofra Archer
Oman need a refresh of their batting after a series of costly false starts
Zeeshan Maqsood needs two more wickets to become the second Oman player with 50 T20I wickets after Bilal Khan
Miscellaneous Highlights: The two matches played at North Sound so far have both been one-sided, which makes judging the surface a little harder
The ball has carried through well, and batters' intent does bring rewards, but the wind is a big factor here
This is the first meeting between England and Oman in a full international fixture
Despite playing 13 times at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium, including twice during December's white-ball tour of the Caribbean, this will be England's first T20I at the venue
Others: England white-ball coach Matthew Mott: "We're treating this game with Oman in isolation. They've got our full attention. We're going to prepare really well for that. And then see what happens in this game."
